content:
Use these settings: incoming IMAP outlook.office365.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address; outgoing smtp.office365.com, 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2, email address. Same for POP, except incoming port 995.

Using any other server names will not offer OAuth2 as authentication, which will be mandatory after mid Sept.
creator: sfhowes

These options are for the respective servers and providers and are unfortunately not subject to settings of these desired options or configuration for them. creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there

This situation can be configured with thunderbird to leave your inbox to make a copy to rename your inbox to erase the inbox .msf file.

Please read the following text . Inbox emails stays blank. Or emails become blank after using the email program.

Exit Thunderbird. Make several copies of the file "Inbox" in safe places (outside your profile folder). Rename the file "Inbox" to "InboxOld". Delete the file "Inbox.msf". Start Thunderbird. It will create a new, empty Inbox.

There should be a new folder InboxOld visible in the folder pane. Right-click it and select "Compact This Folder". If this succeeds, try to open it.

If you can open it without problems, you are done and you can delete the copies (after you make very sure).

Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
We cannot verify a single email address, but here are some suggestions: - check your online account, as some email providers do their own spam checking - mark that message as 'not spam' when it appears and also periodically mark other messages, both good and bad. That is how thunderbir learns - for a particular email address that consistently fails, I suggest creating a filter to bypass spam checking. This URL may also help. I agree, spam is sometimes difficult to stop. 

 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: davidsk

content: I am unclear on the question. Those words are valid for a profile, but if you copied profile from another PC, the profile name would have stayed the same. Is this a curiosity question, or is this a problem? Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, if it was an IMAP account, nothing is lost. Just recreate it. If it was a POP account, it depends on how you removed it. During the removal, the first pane shown after clicking to remove includes a checkbox to remove data. If you left that unticked, then your messages should all still be in the profile. You can verify that by these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you are now in the profile, click the Mail folder and I believe it will show your removed account name. - click that and I believe you will see you message folders, such as input, input.msf, sent, sent.msf, etc.

Report back on that and we can discuss next steps
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest updating the desktop to the 128 version from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/ clicking help>about on your desktop thunderbird may also show the update option. You can install over the top of current version by downloading, exiting thunderbird, and executing the update.
